result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrea L. Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Submit to AODA and follow through with all recommendations of the assessor.

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete anger management class.

Follow all rules of probation.

Pay costs.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Andrea L. Clark in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Probation agent Popp appeared in person.  ADA Forehand makes comments and asks that some conditional time be ordered, stay 2 months.  Comments by def.  Comments by Popp.  Court grants request by ADA Forehand, orders 30 days jail, imposed and stayed for 60 days, to allow def time to comply with the probation.
Probation review hearing on March 1, 2017 at 09:00 am.

P/P Agent's request for probation review hrg
of Conviction - "extend supervision for 1 year or until completion of court ordered conditions including AODA assessment/recommendations and anger management"
for extension of probation - Court refers back to agent - to sign this, would need stipulation of the defendant
phone call from Agent - DOC will be forwarding proposed order for extention as a follow-up to the Court's directive noted on 11-15-16
Court's letter response to 11-8-16 letter from DOC - Per Judge Sharp "Extend her supervision."
letter from P&P re def failed to meet court ordered conditions

Defendant Andrea L. Clark in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Today was set as adjourned initial.  Def states she wants to proceed to plea/sentencing; has filled out waiver of counsel and plea waiver forms for Court's review after speaking with ADA and receiving State's offer for probation.  Court's colloquy with def re waiver of counsel.  Def pleads no contest as charged.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  Court follows the plea agreement.  1 year probation with conditions of aoda/follow through; succ. completion and payment of anger mgt class; follow all rules of probation; pay costs as a condition as well.

Defendant Andrea L. Clark in court. Prosecuting Atty John L. Conlon appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Conlon provides def with the complaint.  Court informs def of her right to counsel.  Def addresses Court re bond.  Court deletes no contact provision.  Court questions def and determines Def will not qualify for SPD or Dean counsel.  Def wishes to waive right to counsel for sole, limited purpose of speaking with prosecutor for offer info.  Court adjourns the initial to 11 on 1/20.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 11:00 am.
